page.title: 07Rubery in the late 1800's
page.content: Rubery village at this time was made up of a few cottages and shops including a Post Office at the bottom of the village, four public houses, about nine farms, one clay pit and the Rubery Hill quarries.There was also a nailers' warehouse at the bottom of Cock Hill Lane. {Rubery could even boast of having its {own railway station, but the most {dominating feature was the newly built {Rubery Lunatic Asylum(as it was then {called), which was opened on 4th {January,1882. The station was about half a mile from the village, at the bottom of Holly Hill and over-looked by The Cock Inn.
